{
  "events": [
    {
      "organization": "European Union",
      "role": "European Commissioner for Development and Humanitarian Aid",
      "location": null,
      "start_date": "2004",
      "end_date": "2009",
      "description": "Responsible for EU's development and humanitarian aid policies, including aid distribution and diplomatic relations with recipient countries.",
      "supporting_quotes": [
        "Critics of Louis Michel's tenure as European Commissioner for Development and Humanitarian Aid (2004–2009) alleged that his Africa policy demonstrated favoritism toward select regimes..."
      ]
    },
    {
      "organization": "European Union",
      "role": "MEP (Member of the European Parliament)",
      "location": null,
      "start_date": null,
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Served as a Member of the European Parliament, where he continued to advocate on issues related to the Middle East.",
      "supporting_quotes": [
        "He later, as an MEP in 2008, described Israel's Gaza border closures as 'collective punishment' of Palestinians..."
      ]
    },
    {
      "organization": "European Union",
      "role": "Advocate for EU Leadership in Lebanon Aid",
      "location": "Lebanon",
      "start_date": null,
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Advocated for the EU's leadership in providing both short-term relief and long-term reconstruction in Lebanon, emphasizing the bloc's balanced relations with regional parties.",
      "supporting_quotes": [
        "He advocated for the EU's potential leadership in both short-term relief and long-term reconstruction, arguing that the bloc's balanced relations with Israel, Lebanon, and Arab states positioned it to mediate politically while delivering aid without favoritism."
      ]
    },
    {
      "organization": "European Union",
      "role": "Critic of Israel's Blockade of Lebanon",
      "location": "Lebanon, Tel Aviv",
      "start_date": "2006",
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Criticized Israel's naval and aerial blockade of Lebanon, urging its immediate lifting to allow humanitarian aid to reach those in need.",
      "supporting_quotes": [
        "Michel repeatedly criticized Israel's naval and aerial blockade of Lebanon, which he said exacerbated the humanitarian crisis by hindering relief deliveries; in August 2006, following a visit to Tel Aviv amid the ongoing conflict, he urged Israel to lift the blockade immediately to allow aid to reach those in need, stating that 'Lebanon is still in an emergency situation.'"
      ]
    },
    {
      "organization": "European Union",
      "role": "Supporter of UN Security Council Resolution 1701",
      "location": "Middle East",
      "start_date": null,
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Supported UN Security Council Resolution 1701 for a ceasefire and Lebanese army deployment in the south, aligning with EU consensus on condemning disproportionate force.",
      "supporting_quotes": [
        "While prioritizing civilian protection, Michel's statements aligned with EU consensus in condemning disproportionate force but stopped short of endorsing Hezbollah's role, instead supporting UN Security Council Resolution 1701 for a ceasefire and Lebanese army deployment in the south."
      ]
    },
    {
      "organization": "European Union",
      "role": "Provider of EU Aid to Palestinian Territories",
      "location": "Palestinian Territories (Gaza and West Bank)",
      "start_date": "2005",
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Extended EU aid to Palestinian territories, signing a €14 million agreement with UNRWA in November 2005 for food aid in Gaza and the West Bank.",
      "supporting_quotes": [
        "In the broader Middle East context, Michel extended EU aid to Palestinian territories during escalations, signing a €14 million agreement with UNRWA in November 2005 for food aid in Gaza and the West Bank, part of a €37 million package where 20% targeted operations there."
      ]
    },
    {
      "organization": "European Union",
      "role": "Backer of Post-Syrian Withdrawal Elections in Lebanon",
      "location": "Lebanon",
      "start_date": "2005, 2009",
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Backed the EU's support for post-Syrian withdrawal elections in Lebanon in 2005 and 2009, emphasizing the need for processes free from external interference.",
      "supporting_quotes": [
        "On Lebanon politically, Michel backed the EU's support for post-Syrian withdrawal elections in 2005 and 2009, insisting on processes free from external interference to bolster democratic institutions amid Hezbollah's influence."
      ]
    }
  ]
}

        "He advocated for the EU's potential leadership in both short-term relief and long-term reconstruction, arguing that the bloc's balanced relations with Israel, Lebanon, and Arab states positioned it to mediate politically while delivering aid without favoritism."
      ]
    },
    {
      "organization": "European Union",
      "role": "Critic of Israel's Blockade of Lebanon",
      "location": "Lebanon, Tel Aviv",
      "start_date": "2006",
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Criticized Israel's naval and aerial blockade of Lebanon, urging its immediate lifting to allow humanitarian aid to reach those in need.",
      "supporting_quotes": [
        "Michel repeatedly criticized Israel's naval and aerial blockade of Lebanon, which he said exacerbated the humanitarian crisis by hindering relief deliveries; in August 2006, following a visit to Tel Aviv amid the ongoing conflict, he urged Israel to lift the blockade immediately to allow aid to reach those in need, stating that 'Lebanon is still in an emergency situation.'"
      ]
    },
    {
      "organization": "European Union",
      "role": "Supporter of UN Security Council Resolution 1701",
      "location": "Middle East",
      "start_date": null,
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Supported UN Security Council Resolution 1701 for a ceasefire and Lebanese army deployment in the south, aligning with EU consensus on condemning disproportionate force.",
      "supporting_quotes": [
        "While prioritizing civilian protection, Michel's statements aligned with EU consensus in condemning disproportionate force but stopped short of endorsing Hezbollah's role, instead supporting UN Security Council Resolution 1701 for a ceasefire and Lebanese army deployment in the south."
      ]
    },
    {
      "organization": "European Union",
      "role": "Provider of EU Aid to Palestinian Territories",
      "location": "Palestinian Territories (Gaza and West Bank)",
      "start_date": "2005",
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Extended EU aid to Palestinian territories, signing a €14 million agreement with UNRWA in November 2005 for food aid in Gaza and the West Bank.",
      "supporting_quotes": [
        "In the broader Middle East context, Michel extended EU aid to Palestinian territories during escalations, signing a €14 million agreement with UNRWA in November 2005 for food aid in Gaza and the West Bank, part of a €37 million package where 20% targeted operations there."
      ]
    },
    {
      "organization": "European Union",
      "role": "Backer of Post-Syrian Withdrawal Elections in Lebanon",
      "location": "Lebanon",
      "start_date": "2005, 2009",
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Backed the EU's support for post-Syrian withdrawal elections in Lebanon in 2005 and 2009, emphasizing the need for processes free from external interference.",
      "supporting_quotes": [
        "On Lebanon politically, Michel backed the EU's support for post-Syrian withdrawal elections in 2005 and 2009, insisting on processes free from external interference to bolster democratic institutions amid Hezbollah's influence."
      ]
    }
  ]
}

{
  "events": [
    {
      "organization": "European Union",
      "role": "Advocate for EU strategic interests and political stability",
      "location": null,
      "start_date": null,
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Advocated for a 'partnership' model that minimized conditionalities on aid flows to high-corruption environments like the DRC.",
      "supporting_quotes": ["Michel advocating a 'partnership' model that minimized conditionalities on aid flows to high-corruption environments like the DRC."]
    },
    {
      "organization": null,
      "role": "Public commentator on DRC elections",
      "location": "DRC",
      "start_date": "2006",
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Publicly hailed the 2006 DRC presidential elections as establishing Congo as a 'democratic state' for the first time since independence.",
      "supporting_quotes": ["Michel publicly hailed the outcome as establishing Congo as a 'democratic state' for the first time since independence."]
    },
    {
      "organization": "European Union",
      "role": "Resisted stronger EU pressure for governance benchmarks",
      "location": null,
      "start_date": null,
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Argued that heavy conditionality alienated African partners and hindered development.",
      "supporting_quotes": ["Michel resisted stronger EU pressure for governance benchmarks, arguing that heavy conditionality alienated African partners and hindered development;"]
    },
    {
      "organization": null,
      "role": "Subject of a Belgian petition demanding resignation",
      "location": "Belgium",
      "start_date": "2006",
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Accused of neocolonialist meddling in the DRC, favoring Kabila's faction while ignoring dissenters and entrenched corruption.",
      "supporting_quotes": ["A July 2006 Belgian petition, initiated by activist Anja Vanduysen, demanded Michel's resignation, branding his DRC engagement as neocolonialist meddling that favored Kabila's faction while ignoring dissenters and entrenched corruption."]
    },
    {
      "organization": null,
      "role": "Rebuked by Belgian Foreign Minister Karel de Gucht",
      "location": "Belgium",
      "start_date": "2008",
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Criticized for overly conciliatory handling of the DRC crisis, implying familial and policy favoritism toward Kinshasa.",
      "supporting_quotes": ["In November 2008, Belgian Foreign Minister Karel de Gucht publicly rebuked Michel—alongside his son Charles Michel, then Belgium's development cooperation minister—for overly conciliatory handling of the DRC crisis, implying familial and policy favoritism toward Kinshasa exacerbated governance impunity."]
    },
    {
      "organization": "European Parliament",
      "role": "Member of the European Parliament for the liberal Mouvement Réformateur",
      "location": null,
      "start_date": null,
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Defended King Leopold II during discussions surrounding the 50th anniversary of the Democratic Republic of the Congo's independence from Belgium.",
      "supporting_quotes": ["In June 2010, during discussions surrounding the 50th anniversary of the Democratic Republic of the Congo's independence from Belgium, Louis Michel, then a Member of the European Parliament for the liberal Mouvement Réformateur, publicly defended King Leopold II, the monarch who personally ruled the Congo Free State from 1885 to 1908."]
    }
  ]
}
```
